treasury_media.title: CASE: Bringing online gaming to the real world with NERF
treasury_media.description:
Roles: Strategist & social creative

I'm very proud to have single-handendly created the "Offline Gaming" strategy with which we mimic popular video games - but this time in the real world with Nerf Blasters. Simon van Gorkum used this to create the Battle Royale campaign, I helped him as social creative.

Awards:
- Bronze Effie 2020
- SAN Award 2019

Nominations:
- Dutch Interactive Awards 2020
- The Best Social Awards 2020
Spin Awards 2020

treasury_media.title: CASE: Bol.com post in RTL Boulevard
treasury_media.description: Imagine this situation: its 17:30 and you're wrapping up things. Then all of the sudden your colleague (Kim Pillen) says "Wesley and Yolanthe broke up". My first reaction was "Okay." only then for Kim to remind us it was inhaker-time. We saw a huge opportunity to refer back to the "Gastendoekjes troubles" many Dutchies know about. Within minutes I created this piece of content with Frank Ouwerkerk by my side, only to see it featured in RTL Boulevard.

treasury_media.title: Volunteering: Rescue cat in your home via AR (on RTL)
treasury_media.description: Many people think that there's something 'wrong' with pets in the animal shelter. With the helps of Augmented Reality and Instagram I tried to prove people wrong. How? By letting you transport a rescue pet into your homes via an Instagram Filter, so you can see rescue pets look quite... well... like any pet.

awards.title: Beste Inhaker 2019
awards.description:
Met bol.com haakten wij razendsnel in op de ‘Dotan-affaire’, de artiest die massaal neppe volgers positieve berichten op zijn Facebookpagina liet plaatsen. Onze post was die dag niet uit de media te slaan, zowel online als in traditionelere media als Metro en RTL Boulevard.

Grote shout-out naar freelancer Richard van Horssen. Hij kaartte het inhaakmoment aan, waarna ik gelijk een bol.com ‘recensiepost’ (een vast format van ons) met vijf sterren voor mij zag. Vervolgens bracht Richard met zijn teksten de post naar een hoger niveau. Deze award is net zo goed zijn award.

awards.title: Best Talent Nominee
awards.description: Based on my work for a friend of mine and a case, I was nominated for the Best Talent award at The Best Social Awards. Unfortunately I didn't win the award, but being nominated was a great compliment on its own.

projects.title: Saving the animal shelter from closure
projects.description:
Stichting Streekdierentehuis 't Julialaantje (SSJ) is an animal shelter situated in Rijswijk that was faced with imminent closure in 2015. I'm proud to have been a part of the team that helped realize a new animal shelter.

To comply with new laws on housings animals, a whopping sum of €300.000 had to be raised to build a new animal shelter with. In my role as Press Officer, I actively helped the board to convince local municipalities to give financial aid. When those negotiations failed, I designed the 'Word Held' (become a hero) campaign. After I presented my concept and proposition to the board and getting a 'go', I designed pamphlets, posters, and online imagery. In collaboration with my brother, the website wordheld.nl was designed. On this site, donating was easy and people received tips, tricks and materials on how to set up their own charity event.

The campaign and the activities of many passionate volunteers have had succes: the shelter re-opened on the 1st of July 2017. After my two years as the Press Officer, I've continued to volunteer every saturday with all the hands-on work in 't Julialaantje.

projects.title: 2014 World Cup: Snuiten vs. Snorharen
projects.description:
Some cats and dogs of animal shelter 't Julialaantje were unfortunate to be long-stay residents. To put these animals in the center of attention, they predicted the results of the 2014 Football World Cup prior to the games. The central narrative was "Who are better at predicting football, cats ("Snorharen", or "Whiskers") or dogs ("Snuiten", or "Snouts")? I produced videos featuring these amazing pets and then wrote multiple press releases on their 'predictions'.

This proved to be successful! De Telegraaf, AD, Omroep West, Linda, FunX: they all featured this story (some even multiple times) in their papers, websites or radio/television channels. In the meantime our long-stay residents stood in the center of attention. Unfortunately the Dutch team didn't win the World Cup, as Elzo the cat had predicted. Bummer...

profile_positions.description: After years of promoting... well, basically anything... I got the change to start promoting things that align with my personal values. At WWF I help promoting their great work for nature, animals and the planet.
profile_positions.title: Social creative

profile_positions.description: Wanting to work at a smaller agency again I joined my old friends at Truus, where I help creating content and campaigns for Domino's, Netflix, Krasloten and TOTO!
profile_positions.title: Content Creative

profile_positions.description:
As of april 2018, the 'a friend of mine' label and twelve other agencies merged into Dept. Together, we reinvent digital. Nobody likes to see interruptive, obtrusive ads. That's why we focus on creating content that deserves your attention. If not, our work will be tapped/swiped/scrolled away without second thought.

I've  worked for Bar-le-Duc, Netflix, bol.com, Gazelle, HAK, JBL, Riedel (Appelsientje, CoolBest, DubbelFrisss, Van de Boom), FrieslandCampina (Chocomel, Milner, Mona, Optimel, Valess, Yazoo), Hans Anders, Tempo Team, TUI, SkyTeam, Philips, Univé, RET, SIRE, NIVEA, Venz, My Little Pony, Nerf, Play-Doh and Fitbit.

Coolest. Job. Evah.

My activities:
- creating engaging social content
- developing social strategies
- community management
- copywriting
- speaking at events
- helping/guiding my awesome team members
profile_positions.title: Content Creative

profile_positions.company: a friend of mine (part of Dept)
profile_positions.description: I used to work at a friend of mine for a whopping 7 months, but then the agency transformed into the Brand & Advertising team of Dept.
profile_positions.title: Content Creative

profile_positions.description:
As part of the International Team, it was my responsibility to design exciting campaigns that raised brand awareness in Belgium. 

Only weeks after my start at TransIP, the company's international expansion strategy became a topic of debate in higher management. The article below (Dutch) describes the struggles TransIP went through as a company. This resulted in my team being cancelled. 

Although the experience was short, it is great to have met many talented people at TransIP.
profile_positions.title: International Marketeer

profile_positions.description:
Being the biggest party store in our region, 't Feesthuis has experienced a lot of growth in the recent years. It proved to be a difficult task for the current employees to coordinate marketing and communications. From january 2015, my main goals were to streamline both the design and execution process of all forms of communication, to manage the marketing budget and to increase the number of sales made in the webshop. 

Mainly the latter proved to be a very exciting challenge. Due to existing technical and organizational limitations, initially it was impossible to run a customer friendly and reliable webshop. I'm proud of the fact that, after many months of hard work, in januari of 2017 a new, user-friendly and SEO-friendly website was launched to get rid of any limitations.

Accomplishments:

• Launched a new, user-friendly and SEO-friendly website
• Designed and introduced a new, more mature corporate identity
• Successfully negotiated to obtain the domain name feesthuis.nl
• Increased the number of online orders from 1 per month to 1 per day (and growing!)
• Lowered the marketing budget by 50% while maintaining positive results
• Wrote article descriptions for 1500+ online products
profile_positions.title: Marketing & Communications employee

profile_positions.description:
In 2013 I was glad to become the Press Officer of my local animal shelter. This organization had stolen my heart in 2012. To have been able to actively make a difference for both the organization and its inhabitants, is something I will cherish for the rest of my life. The job came with many responsibilities, but always gave me loads and loads of energy.

Responsibilities:

• Maintaining press relations
• Writing Press Releases
• Being the first point of contact for the press 24/7
• Spokesmanship for newspapers and during (live) radio and television interviews
• Grabbing every opportunity to actively promote the animal shelter and its inhabitants

Special accomplishments (see 'projects' below for further elaboration):

• Got national publicity with my 2014 Football World Cup project
• Helped saving the animal shelter from imminent closure in 2015
profile_positions.title: Press Officer

profile_positions.description:
Babana Media is a company specialized in designing print media, websites and animations. 'Babana' meaning 'Brothers' in the aboriginal language, my brother and I joined forced in this company. Through Babana we've met a diverse group of clients, each with their unique wishes. 

Babana continuously forced me to step up my game, learn and evolve. With success I must conclude, since most of our clients learned about us through word-of-mouth. However, as of 2015, Babana Media is solely used as platform for cool challenges we want to tackle in our spare time.

Amongst things that I've created are:

• Accessible and appealing infographics about complicated subsidies
• Animated music videos for headliner bands
• Company logos
• Many, many flyers and print adverts
profile_positions.title: Co-owner/ Graphic Designer/ Animator

volunteer_experiences.description:
Every saturday morning I helped the people of Animal Shelter 't Julialaantje with taking care of all the cats, dogs and other animals. 

For example, I helped cleaning the rooms in which the cats stay and I take the dogs out for a walk. I often also photograph their pets with my DLSR camera and shoot videos of them. First impressions counts, so a good photo or video really helps them to get adopted sooner.

Furthermore, from October 2012 to Februari 2015 I was part of the shelter's PR-team (also on voluntary basis). I used my knowledge on communication and graphical skills to help promoting our animals. During this period of time I also took the role of Press Officer on me. This meant I was a first point of contact for media and continuously supplied stories from the shelter to media.
